author: Brad Leithauser
title: ‘Something Wonderful’ Review: The Winning Marquee
text:
The terrain mapped by Todd S. Purdum’s “Something Wonderful” shifts underfoot. The book’s subtitle is “Rodgers and Hammerstein’s Broadway Revolution,” but many early pages are devoted to Lorenz Hart, Oscar Hammerstein’s predecessor as Richard Rodgers’s lyricist. Hammerstein died in 1960, but indefatigable Rodgers went on finding notable collaborators (Stephen Sondheim, Sheldon Harnick), and “Something Wonderful” follows him into this territory as well. We have here Rodgers pre- and post-Hammerstein.
The book’s ranginess...
